result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett Peter Degroot Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Update Info (2nd+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett Peter Degroot Jr

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brett Peter Degroot Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Brett Peter Degroot Jr. Plea Questionnaire has been filed. Schiek states case is a prison sentence. Court would like to do plea today and set sentencing out. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Court revokes bond. adj. 03:46 PM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brett Peter Degroot Jr appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Brett Peter Degroot Jr. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 09:34 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brett Peter Degroot Jr appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appearing by video. Svehlek states Defendant is eligible for PD and she will be representing. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel.  Schiek/Svehlek statement to bail.  Court sets bond. Svehlek would like set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. adj. 01:30 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
